=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Grizzly Man
Review Date: 2005/12/30
Store: Timothy Treadwell  (Actor),     Werner Herzog  (Director)    Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Lionsgate Home Entertainment, Lionsgate Indie Selects
Product Description: ['In this mesmerizing new film, acclaimed director Werner Herzog explores the life and death of amateur grizzly bear expert and wildlife preservationist Timothy Treadwell, who lived unarmed among grizzlies for 13 summers.']
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Documentary', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Timothy Treadwell, Werner Herzog', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 43 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '31398186366', 'Director': 'Werner Herzog', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 43 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 26, 2005', 'Actors': 'Timothy Treadwell', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I thought I was going to see some really outstanding grizzly filming.  This movie should have been labeled "One man's descent into insanity".  Timothy Treadwell was a self absorbed,selfish, egocentric man and this story is about him and not the bears.  Due to his own behavior he became a  dish for one of the bears.  Too bad he took someone else along with him to his death. A couple of the bears he "loved" so much had to be murdered because of his behavior.  I would not recommend this movie.
Review Title: Conservationist? Who? Timothy Treadwell?
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------

**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user shows a clear interest in documentaries, particularly those that explore complex human narratives intertwined with nature.
- **Critique Style:** Values objective storytelling and critical representation of subjects; expresses disappointment when personal issues overshadow the broader thematic elements. This user prefers films that prioritize fact and educational content over sensationalism.
- **Cultural Critique:** Displays skepticism towards certain portrayals of conservationists, identifying egocentrism as a major flaw in character narratives. This suggests a preference for narratives that balance personal stories with broader environmental themes.
- **Viewing Expectations:** Anticipates high-quality cinematography and insightful commentary but is disappointed by films that deviate to psychological or sensational narratives without adequate context.
- **Recommendation Stance:** Willing to provide strong negative feedback if content does not meet expectations, indicating a tendency towards forthright critiques based on individual viewing experiences.

Overall, the user values authenticity and thoughtful representation in documentary filmmaking, while openly critiquing works that seem to prioritize sensationalism or misrepresentation of their subjects.
